contents.content: As unpredictable and varied as any the peoples on Golarion, humans have the exceptional drive and capacity to endure and expand. Though many civilizations thrived before humanity rose to prominence, humans have built some of the greatest and the most terrible societies throughout the course of history, and today they are the most populous people in the realms around the Inner Sea.

Generally taller than humans, and with a fragile grace accentuated with long facial features and sharply pointed ears. Broad pupils fill their wide eyes, giving elves an alien look and allowing them to see sharply even in very little light.

You have a knack for learning, and from a young age, you sequestered yourself from the outside world to learn all that you could. You’ve read about so many wondrous places and things in your books, and you’ve always dreamed about one day seeing the real things. Eventually, that curiosity led you to leave your studies and become an adventurer.
Expend the power stored in your arcane focus to cast one spell you prepared and cast today, without spending a spell slot.
Expend a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature’s casting of that same spell. Roll a counteract check using the spell’s level against the caster’s spell DC.
Expend a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature’s casting of that same spell. Roll a counteract check using the spell’s level against the caster’s spell DC.
An animal serves you and assists your spellcasting.

Touch one ally or enemy
All allies or all enemies in range
All allies and enemies in range
Never flat-footed against creatures of a lower level.
Master at Fortitude saves
When you succeed at a Fortitude save, treat it as a critical success.
Legendary at Fortitude saves
When you critically fail a Fortitude save, treat it as a failure. When you fail a Fortitude save against an effect that deals damage, you halve the damage you take.
Expert at simple and martial weapons, and unarmed attacks
Master at Will saves
When you succeed at a Will save, treat it as a critical success.
If you succeed at a melee Strike against a target with resistance against the physical damage type of the weapon or unarmed attack you’re using, reduce that resistance.
After raging, you are fatigued for 1 round.
While raging, cannot use actions that require concentration, except for Seek.
To melee and unarmed strikes
Gain critical specialization for your melee weapon or unarmed attack.
Use one of your rage actions as a free action.
Don’t become fatigued after you stop raging. It still takes the normal amount of time before you can use Rage again.
Pick your race and where your character comes from.
Decide how your character grew up.
Pick from one of the available classes.
You may need to pick a specialisation, such as a Sorcerer's bloodline or Cleric's domain.
Refer to your ancestry, background, class and feats to find your initial proficiencies.
Then spend the skill proficiencies your class provides to upgrade skills.

Add up the ability score bonuses you get from your ancestry, background and class, each of which provides +2 or -2 to a number of abilities. You also get four free ability boosts to allocate as you wish.
Your key ability comes from your class, and is used to determine your class DC.
Calculate your hit points. Some of these come from your ancestry, and some each level from your chosen class.
Work out what your character owns at the start of the game, including clothes and weapons.
